newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: SA Druggists upgrades research unit.
newsitem.headline: SA Druggists upgrades research unit.

text.p: Pharmaceuticals firm South African Druggists Ltd (SAD) said on Wednesday that it has invested 10 million rand in upgrading its research and development facility in Port Elizabeth.

"With the upgraded facilities...we expect to be able to make some major announcements/pharmaceutical breakthroughs in the next couple of years," said Alistair Strachan, divisional manager of SAD unit Druggists Group Reasearch (DGR).
DGR has filed 15 patents in the last three years and currently has 17 drug candidates under experimental evaluation and four at an advanced stage of development, the firm said.
The Port Elizabeth site has research and development laboratories and a pilot-scale production plant.
